s.text: To make it look more authentic, Sedelmaier corrupted the new animation by transferring the negative to a second one to make the cartoon look 25 years old.
To make it look more authentic, Sedelmaier corrupted the new animation by transferring the negative to a second one to make the cartoon look 25 years old.
To make it look more authentic, Sedelmaier corrupted the new animation by transferring the negative to a second one to make the cartoon look 25 years old.
Another note of authenticity: The explosive sound effects come from the show's old episodes.
Speed's obviously rattled mechanic-friend, Pops, expresses panic--"Speed, if you don't win, we could lose everything."

As he jumps from the GTI in the cartoon's patented style, Speed delivers the VW slogan in voice-over, shifting from nostalgia to the now: "On the road of life, there are passengers and there are drivers."

The twentysomethings and thirtysomethings spent their time as passengers; their parents were driving while they were watching Speed Racer . Now, Sedelmaier's spot brilliantly suggests, it's their time to do the driving--in cars and in life.
